summary: Placing before the voters a proposition authorizing issuance of unlimited tax general obligation bonds; providing for the submission to the qualified electors of the City at a special election to be held therein on May 21, 1996, a proposition authorizing the City to incur indebtedness by issuing its general obligation bonds, payable by annual property tax levies to be made in excess of regular property tax levies and by other money of the City legally therefor, for the purpose of paying all or part of the cost of improvements in the South Lake Union area, including without limitation a Commons park, improvements within or near that park, and affordable housing in the South Lake Union area; providing for the annual levy and collection of those excess property taxes; and finding an emergency and requesting a special election.
